info.description: This is the public Twilio REST API.
info.title: Twilio - Voice

/v1/ByocTrunks.description: BYOC Trunks allow you to bring your own voice carrier to Twilio, enabling your calls to use our Programmable Voice APIs.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

CnamLookupEnabled.description: Whether Caller ID Name (CNAM) lookup is enabled for the trunk. If enabled, all inbound calls to the BYOC Trunk from the United States and Canada automatically perform a CNAM Lookup and display Caller ID data on your phone. See [CNAM Lookups](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sip-trunking#CNAM) for more information.

ConnectionPolicySid.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that Twilio will use when routing traffic to your communications infrastructure.

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

FromDomainSid.description: The SID of the SIP Domain that should be used in the `From` header of originating calls sent to your SIP infrastructure. If your SIP infrastructure allows users to "call back" an incoming call, configure this with a [SIP Domain](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/sending-sip) to ensure proper routing. If not configured, the from domain will default to "sip.twilio.com".

StatusCallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

StatusCallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

VoiceFallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

VoiceFallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML from `voice_url`.

VoiceMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

VoiceUrl.description: The URL we should call when the BYOC Trunk receives a call.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the BYOC Trunk resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/ByocTrunks/{Sid}.description: BYOC Trunks allow you to bring your own voice carrier to Twilio, enabling your calls to use our Programmable Voice APIs.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the BYOC Trunk resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the BYOC Trunk resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

CnamLookupEnabled.description: Whether Caller ID Name (CNAM) lookup is enabled for the trunk. If enabled, all inbound calls to the BYOC Trunk from the United States and Canada automatically perform a CNAM Lookup and display Caller ID data on your phone. See [CNAM Lookups](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sip-trunking#CNAM) for more information.

ConnectionPolicySid.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that Twilio will use when routing traffic to your communications infrastructure.

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

FromDomainSid.description: The SID of the SIP Domain that should be used in the `From` header of originating calls sent to your SIP infrastructure. If your SIP infrastructure allows users to "call back" an incoming call, configure this with a [SIP Domain](https://www.twilio.com/docs/voice/api/sending-sip) to ensure proper routing. If not configured, the from domain will default to "sip.twilio.com".

StatusCallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `status_callback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

StatusCallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

VoiceFallbackMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_fallback_url`. Can be: `GET` or `POST`.

VoiceFallbackUrl.description: The URL that we should call when an error occurs while retrieving or executing the TwiML requested by `voice_url`.

VoiceMethod.description: The HTTP method we should use to call `voice_url`

VoiceUrl.description: The URL we should call when the BYOC Trunk receives a call.

/v1/ConnectionPolicies.description: Connection Policy for sending traffic to your communications infrastructure.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

/v1/ConnectionPolicies/{ConnectionPolicy.description: Network element entry points into your communications infrastructure

parameters.description: The SID of the Connection Policy from which to read the Targets.
parameters.name: ConnectionPolicySid

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

parameters.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that owns the Target.
parameters.name: ConnectionPolicySid

Enabled.description: Whether the Target is enabled. The default is `true`.

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

Priority.description: The relative importance of the target. Can be an integer from 0 to 65535, inclusive, and the default is 10. The lowest number represents the most important target.

Target.description: The SIP address you want Twilio to route your calls to. This must be a `sip:` schema. `sips` is NOT supported.

Weight.description: The value that determines the relative share of the load the Target should receive compared to other Targets with the same priority. Can be an integer from 1 to 65535, inclusive, and the default is 10. Targets with higher values receive more load than those with lower ones with the same priority.

parameters.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that owns the Target.
parameters.name: ConnectionPolicySid

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Target resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/ConnectionPolicies/{ConnectionPolicy.description: Network element entry points into your communications infrastructure

parameters.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that owns the Target.
parameters.name: ConnectionPolicySid

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Target resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The SID of the Connection Policy that owns the Target.
parameters.name: ConnectionPolicySid

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Target resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

Priority.description: The relative importance of the target. Can be an integer from 0 to 65535, inclusive. The lowest number represents the most important target.

Target.description: The SIP address you want Twilio to route your calls to. This must be a `sip:` schema. `sips` is NOT supported.

Weight.description: The value that determines the relative share of the load the Target should receive compared to other Targets with the same priority. Can be an integer from 1 to 65535, inclusive. Targets with higher values receive more load than those with lower ones with the same priority.

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Connection Policy resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/ConnectionPolicies/{Sid}.description: Connection Policy for sending traffic to your communications infrastructure.

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Connection Policy resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The unique string that we created to identify the Connection Policy resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

post.description: Create a bulk update request to change voice dialing country permissions of one or more countries identified by the corresponding [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

UpdateRequest.description: URL encoded JSON array of update objects. example : `[ { "iso_code": "GB", "low_risk_numbers_enabled": "true", "high_risk_special_numbers_enabled":"true", "high_risk_tollfraud_numbers_enabled": "false" } ]`

get.description: Retrieve all voice dialing country permissions for this account

parameters.description: Filter to retrieve the country permissions by specifying the [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)
parameters.name: IsoCode

parameters.description: Filter to retrieve the country permissions by specifying the continent
parameters.name: Continent

parameters.description: Filter the results by specified [country codes](https://www.itu.int/itudoc/itu-t/ob-lists/icc/e164_763.html)
parameters.name: CountryCode

parameters.description: Filter to retrieve the country permissions with dialing to low-risk numbers enabled. Can be: `true` or `false`.
parameters.name: LowRiskNumbersEnabled

parameters.description: Filter to retrieve the country permissions with dialing to high-risk special service numbers enabled. Can be: `true` or `false`
parameters.name: HighRiskSpecialNumbersEnabled

parameters.description: Filter to retrieve the country permissions with dialing to high-risk [toll fraud](https://www.twilio.com/learn/voice-and-video/toll-fraud) numbers enabled. Can be: `true` or `false`.
parameters.name: HighRiskTollfraudNumbersEnabled

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

get.description: Retrieve voice dialing country permissions identified by the given ISO country code

parameters.description: The [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) of the DialingPermissions Country resource to fetch
parameters.name: IsoCode

get.description: Fetch the high-risk special services prefixes from the country resource corresponding to the [ISO country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

parameters.description: The [ISO 3166-1 country code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) to identify the country permissions from which high-risk special service number prefixes are fetched
parameters.name: IsoCode

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

/v1/IpRecords.description: IP Records hold information about the IP addresses and ranges ([CIDR](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4632) blocks) that your traffic will be associated with.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

CidrPrefixLength.description: An integer representing the length of the [CIDR](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4632) prefix to use with this IP address. By default the entire IP address is used, which for IPv4 is value 32.

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

IpAddress.description: An IP address in dotted decimal notation, IPv4 only.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/IpRecords/{Sid}.description: IP Records hold information about the IP addresses and ranges ([CIDR](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4632) blocks) that your traffic will be associated with.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

FriendlyName.description: A descriptive string that you create to describe the resource. It is not unique and can be up to 255 characters long.

get.description: Retrieve voice dialing permissions inheritance for the sub-account

post.description: Update voice dialing permissions inheritance for the sub-account

DialingPermissionsInheritance.description: `true` for the sub-account to inherit voice dialing permissions from the Master Project; otherwise `false`.

/v1/SourceIpMappings.description: With Source IP Mappings, Twilio can recognize your SIP requests based on where they are sent from. The Request-URI no longer has to have the FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) of your SIP Domain.

parameters.description: How many resources to return in each list page. The default is 50, and the maximum is 1000.
parameters.name: PageSize

IpRecordSid.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to map from.

SipDomainSid.description: The SID of the SIP Domain that the IP Record should be mapped to.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to delete.
parameters.name: Sid

/v1/SourceIpMappings/{Sid}.description: With Source IP Mappings, Twilio can recognize your SIP requests based on where they are sent from. The Request-URI no longer has to have the FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name) of your SIP Domain.

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to fetch.
parameters.name: Sid

parameters.description: The Twilio-provided string that uniquely identifies the IP Record resource to update.
parameters.name: Sid

SipDomainSid.description: The SID of the SIP Domain that the IP Record should be mapped to.
